chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex L Hajdasz

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video, in custody, in Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

COVERS 21CF102, 21CF379, and 22CF60. 
Pre-filed Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights discussed. 

21CF102- No contest plea entered.  

21CF379-Dismissed and read in.

22CF60-Dismissed and read in. 

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty. Court orders PSI.  Next hearing to be in person.   Bond to continue.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Plea hearing on September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Def's NOH sent to him at the Chippewa Co Jail

9:27 AM Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video, in custody from Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reporter appeared by zoom.
Covers 21CF102 and 21CF379
Court relates.  Attorney Gill requests plea hearing.  Next hearing before Judge Bitney.  22CF60 to be scheduled for same date and time.  Bonds continued.
Plea hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Count 3
Arraignment on October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.; mailed to Defendant at Chippewa County Jail on 8/15/22

9:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video, in custody at the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz. 
9;08 a.m. Deputy David Hibbard of the Barron County Sheriffs Dept called and sworn.  Direct by State. 9:13 a.m. Cross by Attorney Gill.  9:14 a.m. Redirect by State.
Court relates, finds probable cause on Count 1 and binds over for trial. Court DOES NOT find probable cause on Count 3 and dismisses Count 3  Arraignment set for 10/07 at 11:00 a.m. and since Defendant will be in custody at Chippewa County he may appear by Zoom.  JA to set up with Chippewa County Jail.  (JA advised).
Arraignment scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.; mailed to Defendant at Chippewa County Jail on 7/29/22

4:06  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video, in custody from Chippewa County Jail. Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz. 

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 21CF102, 21CF379 AND 22CF60

4:06  Court relates and gives appearances.  This is a competency hearing.  Competency report was filed just today.
4:07  State relates.
4:07  Atty. Gill relates.
4:08  State relates and believes finding of competency
4:09  Mr. Hajdasz relates.
4:11  Atty. Gill believes defendant is competent to assist in his defense and does not contest the findings of examiner.
4:12 Court relates and does not believe defendant is objecting or contesting the opinion of examiner who conducted evaluation in these cases.
Court finds no one is contesting the opinion of examiner and finds defendant is competent to proceed in all above cases. 

22CF60:  Case set before Judge Babler; preliminary hearing set for 8/12/2022 at 9:00 AM for 15 minutes; Atty. Gill and Mr. Hajdasz may appear by zoom video.

21CF102 and 21CF379:  Set for hearing 8/19/2022 at 1:30 AM (may be by zoom video).  

Bonds to continue.

(MS scanned to jail)
Amended Order
Order for competency examination by Department of Health Services.

10:37 AM  Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video, in custody at Rusk County Jail.  Attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz. 
COVERS 21CF102, 21CF379.  Court also calls 22CF60 - WARRANT.
Court relates Competency Hearings are set for 21CF102 and 21CF379 for July 25, 2022, and relates discovering warrant in 22CF60 when setting other file/s for today.   Court relates JA received information that the evaluation from Rusk County was already completed and today's hearing is to address whether that evaluation should be considered for Barron County files also instead of ordering another exam.  State relates.  Attorney Gill relates that Defendant was found competent in Rusk County, but believes it's a good idea to have another evaluation.  Court relates and orders that DHHS prepare an addendum and update the competency report and they are to provide all of the information previously published and there should be something in the report that the current charges have been included.  

Warrant quashed in 22CF60 and to be included in the revised competency order. Competency hearing set for the same date and time as other files.  State to prepare an amended Order to to include DHHS is to provide amended/updated report to include new file of 22CF60 and address specific allegations in all cases.  22CF60 will remain assigned to Judge Babler for now, but Judge Boyle will hear the competency hearing.
Competency hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Body only - Wisconsin & adjacent States

11:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Alex L Hajdasz not in court.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Alex L Hajdasz. 
Attorney Gill attempted telephone contact with the Defendant. Court issues a bench warrant - body only - Wisconsin and Adjacent States.
Motion hearing on April 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Motion for Bond Modification
Adjourned initial appearance on April 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

MODIFIED 3/16/22:  DEFENDANT MAY BE RELEASED FROM JAIL AND MUST POST THE $250.00 CASH BOND BY 4:00 P.M. ON MARCH 17, 2022.  ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

11:30 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michael J Steuer for Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video for today.
Qualifies for Public Defender and will try to appoint Attorney Gill. Next hearing may be by zoom before Judge Boyle. Defendant requests bond modification. 11:32 Attorney Steuer and Defendant put in a break out room 11:39 Attorney Steuer relates 11:41 State objects to signature bond or lower cash bond 11:42 Court modifies bond so that defendant may be released and must post the $250.00 cash by 4:00 p.m. tomorrow, March 17, 2022.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Andrew T Knaak (for today) for Alex L Hajdasz appeared by video. 

Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. 

AIA set; may appear by zoom video.
